column1: Thereupon Mr. Starling flew at Mrs. Sparrow. Mr. Sparrow
column3: went at Mr. Starling. Mrs. Sparrow's brother-in-law paid his respects to Mrs. Starling. There was a lively fight.It ended in the defeat of the sparrows. The starlings were too big for them. The sparrows retreated in good order
column4: and left the starlings to enjoy their triumph."Now
column7: and put the house in order. I'll warrant those vulgar sparrows have made a nice mess in there. Sweep the floors
column9: and get the beds made. I'll stay here in the garden
column10: and rest myself.""Just like that husband of mine!" muttered Mrs. Starling: "I must do all the work
column11: while he has all the fun. But I suppose there's no help for it."So she flew up to the door of the house; but
column13: she could not get through it: the opening was not large enough."Well
column15: said she, I do believe we have made a mistake. This is not our house
